question: Where do you run?
answer: We have a lot of different routes all over Auckland and change location every Sunday. Check out our routes page and calendar page for more details

question: Do you only run on the road
answer: We have a mix of routes, with some on the road and some on the trail, and a few that mix the two. We try to mix it up!

question: What do I need to bring
answer:
Yourself and a friend or two! If it’s summer then sunscreen and sunglasses are always a good idea!
You don’t need any special gear to run with us but a running watch can help you keep the pace

question: What speed do you run?
answer: At the start of our group run we break into pace groups of 4:30/km through to 7:00/km at intervals of 30s. We call these runs LSR (long slow run) and you should aim to run at a slow conversational pace.

question: Is there somewhere to put my keys
answer: During the Sunday group run, most of us run with our keys on us. If you're running in one of the larger groups, you may be able to put your keys in someone else's running pack or car.

question: How do I become a member?
answer: For now, we don't have a formal membership system. Join us on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/groups/metrorun.nz/ and come along next Sunday to our group run.

question: What's with all the Tempofit shirts?
answer: Prior to Metrorun, many of the club members were members of the Tempofit running community started by Hayden Shearman. Metrorun has taken over from Tempofit as a community driven endeavour to replace the paid training which is no longer offered.

question: Do I need to be a member to attend the group run?
answer: The short answer is no - the group run is free and all are welcome, but we would really like you to provide your contact details via the membership form so we have a way of reaching you in case there's a problem.

question: How much does it cost?
answer: Currently, you can join our club for free and the Sunday group run will always be free. From time to time we may ask for a donation for equipment. We also have running shirts, but these are purchased at the time of printing independently to the club membership.
